Edit on GitHub

Visualization

The visualization is provided by MeshCat. MeshCat is a remotely-controllable 3D viewer, built on top of three.js. he MeshCat viewer runs in a browser and listens for geometry commands over WebSockets. This makes it easy to create a tree of objects and transformations by sending the appropriate commands over the websocket.

Julia bindings to the MeshCat WebGL viewer are still very basic but work for the most necessary applications. API Reference

The three.js webpage offers lots of examples and usefull tools like MeshPhongMaterial where you can test the appearance of different materials.

The visualisation can be used to display e.g. the current position, orientation, flap position, propeller thrust as well as a target position in the web browser http://localhost:8701.

Functions

Modules = [Visualization]
Order   = [:function, :type]
